description.narrative: 7.3. By 2021, communities in selected rural districts have the capacity to engage with service providers and elected officials to demand accountability of the delivery of quality social services

sector.narrative: Building global / regional / national stakeholder research capacity
Cash Transfers: Delivery of cash transfers through government system (beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
Evaluation innovation learning, uptake and partnerships for evaluation
PF4C: Budget transparency, accountability and participation

title.narrative: Zambia United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Programmes in Zambia (Social Policy Research)

"2019 Zambia: Outcome evaluation of the investment in institutional community and individual capacity development"

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 7.3. By 2021, communities in selected rural districts have the capacity to engage with service providers and elected officials to demand accountability of the delivery of quality social services

description.narrative: UNICEF has improved the data, evidence and knowledge about children through secondary data analysis of the Zambia Demographic and Health Survey (ZDHS), through intensification of the implementation research agenda for early childhood development, ending child marriage, and nutrition, through conducting rapid assessments of the impact of COVID-19 in Zambia, especially in relation to children, and supporting Knowledge, Attitudes and Practices (KAP) studies. Furthermore, UNICEF has continued its strategic partnerships with government entities and academia to strengthen data processes, data management and overall use of data and research findings. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2020

title.narrative: National Surveys Questionnaire include key child SDG indicators and are regularly conducted
Curriculum for building Evaluation Capacity for Government staff available
Existence of a National Research Repository
